ai.summary: Stage 08 of the London to Walsingham route is a demanding long-distance segment totaling 54.1 km. It blends urban fringe walking with rural lanes, fields, and occasional muddy or uneven sections, requiring strong stamina, solid navigation, and preparedness for changing weather. This stage suits experienced hikers comfortable with long days and variable surfaces.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed terrain including urban sidewalks and quiet roads at the start, followed by gravel tracks, chalk lanes, hedgerows, and farmland paths. Expect uneven footing, potential mud after rain, and brief ascents. Navigation may involve rural junctions; some stretches can be exposed to wind.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a full-day hike with adequate daylight; check the forecast and have a contingency plan for rain. Carry navigation tools (map, compass or GPS) and ensure your phone is charged. Wear sturdy boots and dress in layers; stay hydrated and take regular breaks. Be mindful of traffic on road segments, and close gates behind you on farmland. Inform someone of your route and estimated finish time. Have an emergency plan and seek shelter if conditions worsen.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support
Water supply (2–3 liters) and a means to purify water if needed
Weather-appropriate layers and a waterproof jacket
Backpack with sufficient capacity (20–30 L) and rain cover
Map and compass or GPS device; fully charged backup power bank
Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries
High-energy snacks and a compact cooking option if desired
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly March–October)

seo.title: London to Walsingham – Stage 08 (54.1 km) – Hard Day Hike
seo.meta_description: Stage 08 of the London to Walsingham trail covers 54.1 km with a hard rating. Explore varied terrain, essential safety tips, and gear recommendations to plan this challenging stage.
